res.content_title: Elon Musk on Space GPUs, AI, Optimus, and his manufacturing method
res.tag_context: SpaceX was extensively discussed as Musk's rocket company that will enable space-based data centers, launch AI satellites, and potentially become a hyperscaler. The conversation covered technical details about Starship, manufacturing challenges, and plans for 10,000+ launches per year.

res.content_title: Elon Musk - "In 36 months, the cheapest place to put AI will be space”
res.tag_context: SpaceX is central to the entire discussion, covering its role in space-based data centers, Starship development, manufacturing challenges, and plans for launching AI infrastructure to space. Musk discusses technical details, bottlenecks, and future scaling plans extensively.

res.content_title: 20VC: SpaceX Completes Acquisition of xAI | The 2026 SaaS Massacre: Public Market Collapse | Microsoft's $360 Billion Market Cap Loss | NVIDIA's $100BN Investment Dispute with OpenAI | Waymo Raises $16 Billion at a $110 Billion Valuation
res.series_name: The Twenty Minute VC (20VC): Venture Capital | Startup Funding | The Pitch
res.tag_context: SpaceX was the primary focus of discussion regarding its acquisition of xAI at a $1.25 trillion valuation. The hosts extensively analyzed the strategic rationale, dilution effects on investors, and Elon Musk's approach to combining his companies.

res.content_title: Capitalism’s Endgame: The Last Companies That Will Ever Exist
res.tag_context: SpaceX was discussed as owning a monopoly on low Earth orbit and enabling the future of AI data centers in space. The conversation covered Starlink satellites, the upcoming $1.5 trillion IPO, and potential merger with xAI as part of a three-company convergence strategy.

res.content_title: Arc Boats Co-Founder and CEO Mitch Lee
res.tag_context: SpaceX is discussed as Ryan Cook's (Mitch's co-founder) previous employer and the source of many early Arc Boats employees. The company's influence on Arc's engineering culture and hiring practices is mentioned, including SpaceX's reaction to losing employees to Arc.

res.content_title: How Elon Builds Trillion-Dollar Companies
res.tag_context: SpaceX was the primary focus of the entire conversation, with extensive discussion of its business model, upcoming IPO, Starlink constellation, Starship development, vertical integration, and future plans for space data centers. The speaker detailed their $1.2 billion investment and the company's evolution from a launch provider to a comprehensive space technology company.

res.content_title: How AI is Reaching the Most Extreme Parts of the World
res.tag_context: SpaceX is discussed extensively as Armada's founding partner and key strategic ally. The conversation covers their Starlink expansion to 150 countries, future plans for moon bases with Optimus robots, potential IPO, and how their partnership enables Armada to be first-mover in infrastructure deployment globally.

res.content_title: AI and the Future of Warfare with US Under Secretary of War Emil Michael
res.series_name: No Priors: Artificial Intelligence | Technology | Startups
res.tag_context: SpaceX is mentioned multiple times as an example of a successful defense contractor that had to sue for its first contract, and as a model for manufacturing excellence and innovation in the defense sector.

res.content_title: AI Hits a Power Wall. Starcloud Launches Data Centers Into Orbit
res.tag_context: SpaceX is discussed extensively as both a key enabler through their Starship launch vehicle and as a potential competitor in orbital data centers. The conversation covers their manufacturing capabilities, reusable rocket technology, and plans for hundreds of gigawatts of orbital computing.

res.content_title: Scott Nolan - CEO of General Matter on Uranium Enrichment  SRS #211
res.tag_context: SpaceX was discussed extensively as Scott's former employer where he worked as one of 35 early employees, helping develop the Falcon propulsion system and Dragon capsule. The conversation covered SpaceX's transformation of the launch industry and parallels to the nuclear fuel challenge.

res.content_title: 20VC's Big Fat Quiz of the Year: Founder, Fund and Breakout Company of 2025 | Predictions for 2026: The Company to Buy, The Biggest Short | Why Salesforce Could Win 2026 and The Tailwinds NVIDIA Will Face
res.series_name: The Twenty Minute VC (20VC): Venture Capital | Startup Funding | The Pitch
res.tag_context: SpaceX was mentioned as likely to have the biggest IPO of all time in 2026, with praise for CEO Gwynne Shotwell's leadership in navigating challenging times. The company was discussed as one of the major IPO candidates for next year.

res.content_title: 20VC: Will SpaceX IPO at $1.5TRN | Will Cursor Kill Figma | Lightspeed Raises $9BN | OpenAI: $1BN from Disney, New CRO & #1 App in App Store | Oracle and Broadcom Hit: Now the Time to Buy?
res.series_name: The Twenty Minute VC (20VC): Venture Capital | Startup Funding | The Pitch
res.tag_context: SpaceX was a major focus regarding rumors of a $1.5 trillion IPO valuation, with extensive discussion about the 'Elon option value' and how to justify such valuations. The hosts analyzed the business fundamentals versus the premium associated with Elon Musk's track record.

res.content_title: 20VC OGs: SpaceX Valued at $800BN & Harvey Raises $160M at an $8BN Price | Airwallex Raises $330M and The Battle with Keith Rabois | Netflix Acquires Warner Brothers | IPO Market Predictions for 2026: Anthropic, Stripe, Databricks and SpaceX
res.series_name: The Twenty Minute VC (20VC): Venture Capital | Startup Funding | The Pitch
res.tag_context: SpaceX was extensively discussed regarding its $800 billion valuation through secondary sales, with detailed analysis of its revenue multiples, growth prospects, and potential IPO timeline. The hosts debated whether the valuation was justified given its $15 billion revenue and growth rate.

res.content_title: Gavin Baker - Nvidia v. Google, Scaling Laws, and the Economics of AI - [Invest Like the Best, EP.451]
res.series_name: Invest Like the Best with Patrick O'Shaughnessy
res.tag_context: SpaceX was discussed as part of the convergence with Tesla and XAI, and crucially for the concept of data centers in space, where Starship rockets would be essential for making space-based AI infrastructure economically viable.

res.content_title: Uncapped #35 | Trae Stephens from Founders Fund
res.tag_context: SpaceX is discussed as a key portfolio company and example of successful manufacturing scaling. Trae references his close relationship with Elon Musk and uses SpaceX as a model for vertical integration and production capabilities.

res.content_title: Julia DeWahl of Antares on building nuclear reactors for the US military
res.tag_context: SpaceX is extensively discussed as Julia's previous employer where she led Starlink's go-to-market operations. The conversation covers lessons learned about customer focus, company culture, and how those experiences inform her approach at Antares.

res.content_title: Ben Horowitz & Marc Andreessen: Why Silicon Valley Turned Against Defense (And How We’re Fixing It)
res.tag_context: SpaceX is highlighted as a transformative company that pioneered new manufacturing processes and served as a training ground for entrepreneurs who later founded other American Dynamism companies. The discussion emphasizes its impact on the broader ecosystem.

res.content_title: Stablecoin special: Zach Abrams (Bridge) and Henri Stern (Privy)
res.tag_context: SpaceX is discussed as a Bridge customer that uses stablecoins for cross-border payments to repatriate funds from international Starlink sales back to the US. Their use case demonstrates practical B2B stablecoin adoption.

res.content_title: State of the Crypto Markets | Livestream
res.tag_context: SpaceX was debated as an investment option alongside OpenAI and Tether, with discussion about its lack of clear competitors and uncertain monetization strategy.

res.content_title: #2404 - Elon Musk
res.tag_context: SpaceX was extensively discussed throughout the podcast, including detailed explanations of Starship development, rocket launches, engine technology, and the company's mission to make life multiplanetary. Musk provided technical details about their achievements and future plans.

res.content_title: CEO Masterclass: How to Get to $100M (Without Imploding)
res.tag_context: SpaceX was used as a prime example of company values in action, with detailed stories about Elon Musk's leadership style including cutting a cracked rocket skirt and driving rockets on trucks to demonstrate speed and unconventional problem-solving.

res.content_title: Casey Handmer of Terraform Industries on solar maximalism, hard tech, and reclaiming the Salton Sea
res.tag_context: SpaceX is discussed extensively as a model for manufacturing excellence, Elon Musk's leadership style, and its dominance in the space industry. Handmer worked there early in his career and frequently references it as an example of successful hardware development.

res.content_title: Dan Sundheim of D1 Capital on the art of public market investing
res.tag_context: SpaceX was discussed as a major D1 private investment, with Sundheim explaining his thesis around Elon Musk's business acumen, the reusable rocket cost reduction strategy, and the optionality in space-based applications.

res.content_title: Unlocking the Road to Energy Abundance with Base Power CEO and Co-Founder Zach Dell
res.series_name: No Priors: Artificial Intelligence | Technology | Startups
res.tag_context: SpaceX was mentioned multiple times as the previous employer of several key Base Power team members, including the co-founder Justin who led manufacturing there, and other executives who brought expertise from SpaceX's operations.

res.content_title: Base Power Raises $1B led by Addition, with Trust Ventures, Valor Equity, Thrive, Lightspeed, a16z, Altimeter, Stepstone, Elad Gil
res.tag_context: SpaceX is frequently referenced as a model for what Base aims to achieve in the energy sector. Several Base team members came from SpaceX, and it's used as an example of disrupting a traditional industry with innovative technology and business models.

res.content_title: Uncapped #27 | Vince Hankes from Thrive Capital
res.tag_context: SpaceX is discussed as one of Thrive's significant holdings and compared to Founders Fund's concentrated investment strategy, highlighting the benefits of long-term concentrated bets.

res.content_title: Cheeky Pint: Marc Andreessen, John Collison & Charlie Songhurst on Tech’s Big Questions
res.tag_context: SpaceX is analyzed as another example of Elon Musk's management approach, particularly regarding capital efficiency, focus on key metrics like dollars per kilo to orbit, and the engineering-first culture.

res.content_title: Marc Andreessen and Charlie Songhurst on the past, present, and future of Silicon Valley
res.tag_context: Discussed alongside Tesla as an example of Elon Musk's management approach, particularly regarding metrics focus (dollars per kilo to orbit) and capital efficiency in hardware companies.

res.content_title: Rocket Lab’s CEO on End-to-End Space Solutions
res.tag_context: SpaceX was discussed as a competitor in the launch market, with specific mentions of Falcon 9 pricing ($80 million vs Neutron's $55 million) and their capability to do responsive launches similar to Rocket Lab.

res.content_title: E214: Inside Look into a $14B Multi-Family Office
res.series_name: How I Invest with David Weisburd
res.tag_context: SpaceX is mentioned multiple times as an example of a valuable private company that Caprock has invested in through co-investments. It's used to illustrate the importance of private market access for high net worth investors.

res.content_title: EXCLUSIVE: Quantum’s SpaceX Moment? Ashlee Vance on PsiQuantum’s Moonshot
res.tag_context: SpaceX was used as a key analogy for hardware development timelines and challenges, with Ashley discussing how it took them from 2003 to around 2018 to truly dominate the rocket industry. The company serves as a reference point for understanding the long development cycles typical of ambitious hardware projects.

res.content_title: Elon Musk on DOGE, Optimus, Starlink Smartphones, Evolving with AI, Why the West is Imploding
res.series_name: All-In with Chamath, Jason, Sacks & Friedberg
res.tag_context: SpaceX was discussed in depth regarding Starship development, recent launches, and future plans for full reusability. The conversation covered technical challenges, regulatory hurdles, and the company's long-term goals for space exploration and Mars colonization.

res.content_title: Ashlee Vance: Stories from Elon, Palmer Luckey, Bryan Johnson & Priscilla Chan
res.tag_context: SpaceX was discussed as an example of Elon Musk's persistence and success, compared favorably to Blue Origin in terms of dominating the rocket business over 20 years.

res.content_title: Katherine Boyle on Shawn Ryan
res.tag_context: SpaceX is mentioned multiple times as a pioneering company in the space industry and as an example of successful innovation in aerospace and defense. Boyle discusses its impact on manufacturing practices and talent development in the sector.

res.content_title: #42 - Casey Handmer, Founder & CEO of Terraform Industries
res.tag_context: SpaceX is extensively discussed as a model company and source of talent for the aerospace industry. The conversation covers SpaceX's impact on creating experienced engineers, the challenges of transitioning SpaceX alumni to new startups, and comparisons with other space companies.

res.content_title: #399 How Elon Works
res.tag_context: SpaceX was a primary focus of the discussion, with extensive details about Elon Musk's management style, engineering principles, and company culture at SpaceX. The transcript covered SpaceX's rocket development, manufacturing processes, and Musk's hands-on approach to problem-solving within the company.

res.content_title: Can America Lead in Uranium Enrichment Again? Featuring Scott Nolan
res.series_name: Betting on America: Winning the Global Tech Race
res.tag_context: SpaceX is frequently referenced as an example of successful public-private partnership in the space industry. It's used to draw parallels with General Matter's approach to reviving uranium enrichment capabilities in the U.S.

res.content_title: E200: 21 Harsh Truths Nobody Will Ever Tell You - Alex Hormozi
res.series_name: How I Invest with David Weisburd
res.tag_context: SpaceX was mentioned multiple times as an example of Elon Musk's management style and company culture. The discussion included SpaceX's mission, recruitment strategies, and operational practices.

res.content_title: How The Rarest Company On Earth Raised $75M
res.tag_context: SpaceX was discussed as the former employer of Vulcan's COO Jake Boles, who brought SpaceX's engineering culture and execution mindset to Vulcan. The company serves as a model for building high-performing engineering teams.

res.content_title: Inside one of the world’s greatest fundraising operations
res.tag_context: SpaceX was discussed in relation to the partnership between St. Jude and Jared Isaacman for a space mission fundraiser. The mission's risks and impact on fundraising were explored.

res.content_title: Lee Robinson of General Matter: Revitalizing American Uranium Enrichment
res.series_name: Advanced Nuclear, the Official Podcast of UCAN Power
res.tag_context: SpaceX is referenced multiple times as a model for General Matter's approach, particularly in terms of engineering culture, fast iteration, and vertical integration. The company's influence on General Matter's hiring and operational strategies is discussed.

res.content_title: Peter Thiel’s $50M Bet on American Nuclear Fuel, General Matter
res.tag_context: SpaceX is discussed as part of Scott Nolan's background and as a model for how General Matter approaches building a national security company. Nolan worked there from 2003-2007 and uses SpaceX's playbook of combining industry expertise with Silicon Valley talent.

res.content_title: The Rise of American Dynamism with a16z
res.tag_context: SpaceX is mentioned multiple times as an example of a successful company in the American Dynamism space. It is discussed in the context of manufacturing innovation and as a source of talent for new startups.

res.content_title: #216 Katherine Boyle - America's Defense Tech Renaissance
res.tag_context: SpaceX is discussed as a pioneering company in the space industry and as an example of successful defense tech investment. Its impact on manufacturing processes and talent development in the industry is highlighted.

res.content_title: Inside Cathie Wood’s Trillion-Dollar Bets: AI, Musk, Robots & Crypto
res.tag_context: SpaceX is extensively discussed for its potential $2.5 trillion valuation by 2030, its Starlink satellite network, and its role in future Mars colonization. The company's impact on reducing launch costs and its competitive advantages are highlighted.

res.content_title: Robinhood Announces Tokenized Stocks! LIVE with CEO Vlad Tenev, Johann Kerbrat, and AJ Warner
res.tag_context: SpaceX was mentioned multiple times as an example of a private company whose shares would be tokenized and made available through Robinhood's new platform. It was used to illustrate the potential of tokenizing private company stocks.

res.content_title: How Tech Can Rebuild America
res.tag_context: SpaceX is discussed multiple times as an example of a successful company working on important national interests. It's cited as a model for combining hardware and software innovation and attracting top talent to challenging problems.

res.content_title: S&P 500 at Historic Highs, Neuralink Update | DJ Seo, Tejpaul Bhatia, Tomasz Tunguz, Kendrick Nguyen, Kirsten Green
res.tag_context: SpaceX was discussed extensively in relation to its valuation, potential public offering, and as an example of Elon Musk's successful private ventures. It was also central to the conversation about Republic's new tokenized investment product.

res.content_title: The Company That Wants To Bring Back Supersonic Jet Travel
res.tag_context: SpaceX is mentioned several times as an example of a successful new entrant in the aerospace industry. The company's approach to vertical integration and efficient manufacturing is compared to Boom Supersonic's strategy.

res.content_title: Balaji Srinivasan - Episode #369
res.tag_context: SpaceX was discussed as an example of Elon Musk's exceptional ability to build complex physical products and as a company statutorily required to hire Americans. It was used to illustrate the difficulty of manufacturing and Musk's unique capabilities as an entrepreneur.
